entry.et: Middle English, probably from Old English scylfe; akin to Old Norse hlīthskjalf Odin's seat

def.dt: :a thin flat usually long and narrow piece of material (as wood) fastened horizontally (as on a wall) at a distance from the floor to hold objects
:one of several similar pieces in a closet, bookcase, or similar structure
:the contents of a shelf the author of a shelf of best sellers
:something resembling a shelf in form or position: as
:a sandbank or ledge of rocks usually partially submerged
:the submerged gradually sloping border of a continent or island :continental shelf
:available from stock :not made to order off the shelf equipment
:in a state of inactivity or uselessness
:an extensive ice sheet originating on land but continuing out to sea beyond the depths at which it rests on the sea bottom
:the period of time during which a material may be stored and remain suitable for use
:the period of time during which something lasts or remains popular

art.capt: continental shelf: 1 seashore, 2 continental shelf, 3 continental slope, 4 abyssal plain, 5 seamount

def.dt: :a shallow submarine plain of varying width forming a border to a continent and typically ending in a comparatively steep slope to the deep ocean floor

art.cap: continental shelf: 1 seashore, 2 continental shelf, 3 continental slope, 4 abyssal plain, 5 seamount

def.dt: :available as a stock item :not specially designed or custom-made off–the–shelf software
area of shelf ice Antarctica in Weddell Sea
area of shelf ice Antarctica in Weddell Sea
area of shelf ice Antarctica in S Ross Sea
